author: Tim Wilkin
title: Forward Charles has heart condition
text:
Albany
Travis Charles, who University at Albany men's basketball coach Will Brown said is the best inside scorer in the program, has yet to practice for the Great Danes.
The 6-foot-6, 235-pound junior from Brooklyn has a heart condition.
Brown disclosed the news to the media before practice Tuesday at SEFCU Arena.
"We have to be cautious, and we have to be careful," Brown said. "He is a young kid, and he has his whole life to live. We want to make sure that day-to-day, long-term, that he is fine. We can't worry about basketball right now as much as I think he is going to be a big part of what we do. But he has to get better first."
Brown said that Charles, who is from Brooklyn, did not feel well Oct. 7, the day before the Danes had their first practice. Charles went straight to the hospital, where he was diagnosed with the condition, which Brown did not disclose.
Charles has been taking medication and responding well to it, Brown said. If all goes well, he could be on the practice floor by Monday.
"It's scary," Brown said. "I am not going to make the decision to put him on the court. That will have to come from the cardiologist and our doctors and trainers."
Charles averaged 13.9 points and 6.7 rebounds for Howard County Community College in Texas last year.
